rules.natural: If the researcher has funding from the grant, then the researcher receives the award of the prize.
Should the lab receive ethics approval from the committee, the lab obtains clearance from biosafety.
Given that the experiment passes the review by the committee, then if the researcher completes the study involving the experiment, the researcher publishes a paper in the journal.
Either the researcher uses an alternative method involving the technique, or if the lab receives ethics approval from the committee, then the experiment passes the review by the committee.
On the condition that the lab receives clearance from biosafety, the experiment meets the standards of the protocol.
Provided that the experiment meets the standards of the protocol, then if the researcher completes the study involving the experiment, the researcher publishes a paper in the journal.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(approved_ethics(lab, committee) -> (completed_study(researcher, experiment) -> published_paper(researcher, journal))) -> terminated_project(researcher, experiment))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that when the lab receives ethics approval from the committee, then if the researcher completes the study involving the experiment, the researcher publishes a paper in the journal, then the researcher terminates the project related to the experiment.
Whenever the researcher lacks funding from the grant, the researcher completes the study involving the experiment.

facts.natural: The lab received ethics approval from the committee.
It is not the case that the researcher published a paper in the journal.
The researcher did not terminate the project related to the experiment.
The researcher did not use an alternative method involving the technique.

target.natural: The researcher received the award of the prize.

(A1 → G).natural: If the researcher has funding from the grant, then the researcher receives the award of the prize.

(A3 → A2).natural: Provided that the researcher completed the study involving the experiment, the researcher publishes a paper in the journal.

(A4 → (A3 → A2)).natural: Whenever the lab receives ethics approval from the committee, it follows that if the researcher completes the study involving the experiment, then the researcher publishes a paper in the journal.

(A4 → A6).natural: In the event that the lab receives ethics approval from the committee, the experiment passes the review by the committee.

(A4 → A8).natural: Should the lab receive ethics approval from the committee, the lab obtains clearance from biosafety.

(A6 → (A3 → A2)).natural: Given that the experiment passes the review by the committee, then if the researcher completes the study involving the experiment, the researcher publishes a paper in the journal.

(A7 ∨ (A4 → A6)).natural: Either the researcher uses an alternative method involving the technique, or if the lab receives ethics approval from the committee, then the experiment passes the review by the committee.

(A8 → (A3 → A2)).natural: Assuming the lab receives clearance from biosafety, then if the researcher completes the study involving the experiment, the researcher publishes a paper in the journal.

(A8 → A9).natural: On the condition that the lab receives clearance from biosafety, the experiment meets the standards of the protocol.

(A9 → (A3 → A2)).natural: Provided that the experiment meets the standards of the protocol, then if the researcher completes the study involving the experiment, the researcher publishes a paper in the journal.

(¬(A4 → (A3 → A2)) → A5).prover9_expression: (-(approved_ethics(lab, committee) -> (completed_study(researcher, experiment) -> published_paper(researcher, journal))) -> terminated_project(researcher, experiment))
(¬(A4 → (A3 → A2)) → A5).natural: If it is not the case that when the lab receives ethics approval from the committee, then if the researcher completes the study involving the experiment, the researcher publishes a paper in the journal, then the researcher terminates the project related to the experiment.

(¬A1 → A2).natural: In case the researcher does not have funding from the grant, the researcher publishes a paper in the journal.

(¬A1 → A3).natural: Whenever the researcher lacks funding from the grant, the researcher completes the study involving the experiment.

A1.natural: The researcher has funding from the grant.

A4.natural: The lab received ethics approval from the committee.

G.natural: The researcher received the award of the prize.

¬A2.natural: It is not the case that the researcher published a paper in the journal.

¬A5.natural: The researcher did not terminate the project related to the experiment.

¬A7.natural: The researcher did not use an alternative method involving the technique.
